How does ensemble learning contribute to: It improves prediction accuracy by combining multiple models.
It reduces the computational cost of running individual models.
It simplifies the interpretation of prediction results.
It increases the speed of model training and validation.
What is the main challenge addressed by: Polyreactivity can lead to poor pharmacokinetics and off-target effects in therapeutic applications.
Polyreactivity increases the production cost of monoclonal antibodies.
Polyreactivity causes antibodies to degrade faster in the bloodstream.
Polyreactivity limits the ability of antibodies to bind to the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
What role do NLP descriptors play in the: They extract evolutionary information from protein sequences to aid in predicting polyreactivity.
They provide a direct measure of antibody binding affinity to the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
They determine the three-dimensional structure of antibody fragments for better modeling.
They identify potential cross-reactive antigens in the human proteome.
Which specific features are important fo: Net charge of CDR loops, presence of tryptophan and glycine in CDR-H3, and lengths of CDR loops.
Hydrophobicity of the antibody surface, presence of cysteine residues, and overall molecular weight.
Binding affinity to the target antigen, presence of disulfide bonds, and isoelectric point.
Thermal stability of the antibody, presence of proline residues, and secondary structure content.
